crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
If an application has security requirements being placed upon users from an authorized IP address perspective, the CRNRSTN Suite :: can manage the configuration of said IP address access permissions from a number of angles. For example, if exclusive access needs to be given to particular users, grantExclusiveAccess() can be used to block ALL IPs access...except for the identified IPs. Conversly, if instead there are particular IPs which need to be blocked, use denyAccess() to specify the blocked IPs; in this case, all other IPs would be given access to the application. It is not recommended that BOTH grantExclusiveAccess() and denyAccess() be used as this can create unpredictable behavior...on top of there being logical inefficiencies.
Using denyAccess(), security protocols for IPv4 and/or IPv6 (testing needed) addresses can be configured to enforce denial of access to the application for said addresses. These security permissions can be accomplished in-line within the CRNRSTN Suite :: configuration file, or if access to these settings needs to be regulated in compliance with...say...the strictly regulated roles and responsibilities of a government or industry workplace setting, the IP access permissions can be decoupled from the primary config file and placed within a remote file in a restricted directory while having the path be provided to the CRNRSTN Suite :: through this same method.
Either way (in-line or path-to-file), IP addresses can be supplied in a number of formats including the use of ranges and asterisk/star-dot (*) notations.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.
If providing path to file [e.g. grantExclusiveAccess([environment-key], [path-to-ip-auth-config-file])], please note that the CRNRSTN Suite :: uses include_once() to access this information.
Currently tested on an ubuntu 4.2 server running PHP Version 5.2.6 and Apache 2.2.11
A working sample of the decoupled IP restrictions configuration file is provided with the class library download and can be found in the /config.ipauthmgr.secure/ directory.

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: A user-defined custom string identifying a specific hosting environment or server profile. E.g. "LOCALHOST_MY_OLD_MAC_TOWER", "LOCALHOST_PC" or "PROD_01".

The CRNRSTN Suite :: will process IP addresses provided in the following formats...e.g., as either an individual value or a comma delimited list:
'127.0.0.1'
'127.0.0.1, 127.*, 128.0.4.50, 128.0.4.60, 130.50.*, 130.51.10.*'
'127.*'
'FE80::210:80FF:FEF3:4605, 130.*,130.51.10.*,FE80::230:80FF:FEF3:4701'
'FE80::230:80FF:FEF3:4701'
